data.title: The Oldest One Hundred Stations
data.text:
This is the Broadcast Archive

Maintained by:

Barry Mishkind - The Eclectic Engineer

It would be a kindness if you'd just send a short note to let me know who you are, and what your interests are. Thanks.

The One Hundred Oldest Stations in the United States

Please note that the definition of "oldest" is based on licenses issued by the DOC,

AND the beginning of regular programming. For example, KCBS' ancestor was on

the air with a regular schedule of programs in 1912 range. The DOC did not truly

have a "broadcast" license until much later. Some suggest WBZ was the first of

these. One thing we know for sure, KDKA was NOT the first broadcaster,

NOT the first to have a "commercial" license, and NOT the first to do news (in

fact the election reports often cited for KDKA's "opening" were done as station 8ZZ.)

For more information, please see http://www.oldradio.com/archives/general/1st.html

(as of 10/20/12)

The information and dates used were adapted from Thomas White's research.

Was KDKA really the first station? Perhaps. Please, read on...

A discussion by Barry Mishkind about which station was on the air first.

Who's On First?

A discussion by Thomas White about which station was on the air first.
